intro: Melandrium stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited catchfly, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded areas. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation.
